Section Navigation

  • Tools

Tools#

surf_stn.voxel_to_ras(voxel_coords: Tensor, affine_matrix: Tensor) → Tensor#

Converts voxel coordinates to RAS coordinates using the given affine_matrix.

Parameters:

  • voxel_coords – coordinates in voxel space of shape N x 3.

  • affine_matrix – the affine matrix of shape 4 x 4 (read from NIfTI file).

Returns:

RAS coordinates of shape N x 3

surf_stn.ras_to_voxel(ras_coords: Tensor, affine_matrix: Tensor) → Tensor#

Converts RAS coordinates to voxel coordinates using the given affine_matrix.

Parameters:

  • ras_coords – coordinates in RAS space of shape N x 3.

  • affine_matrix – the affine matrix of shape 4 x 4 (read from NIfTI file).

Returns:

voxel coordinates of shape N x 3

surf_stn.to_function(affine_matrix: Tensor) → Callable[[Tensor], Tensor]#

Converts the given affine_matrix to the corresponding function.

Parameters:

affine_matrix – the affine matrix of shape 4 x 4 (read from NIfTI file).

Returns:

the function corresponding to the given affine_matrix.

surf_stn.crop_vol(vol_arr: Tensor, i_min: int, i_max: int, j_min: int, j_max: int, k_min: int, k_max: int) → Tuple[Tensor, Tensor]#

Crops the given volume tensor vol_arr using the given indices. Also returns the affine matrix corresponding to the cropping operation.

Parameters:

vol_arr – the given volume tensor of shape 1 x 1 x H x W x D.

Returns:

cropped volume and the corresponding affine matrix.

surf_stn.unstructured_interpolation(values: Tensor, voxel_coords: Tensor, mode: str = 'bilinear') → Tensor#

Sample values at given points using the interpolation mode of choice.

Parameters:

  • values – the given tensor of shape 1 x C x H x W (x D) from which new values are interpolated from.

  • voxel_coords – voxel coordinates of the given points of shape N_p x dim at which new values are sampled.

  • mode – used in F.grid_sample. Default: ‘bilinear’.

Returns:

sampled values of shape N_p x C

Note:

Internally, points are first reshaped N_p x dim -> 1 x 1 (x 1) x N_p x dim. Then, F.grid_sample produces output of shape 1 x C x 1 (x 1) x N_p. We finally obtained the sampled values by reshaping 1 x C x 1 (x 1) x N_p -> N_p x C.

Coordinates of the given point should be in the implicit coordinate system implied by values. Coordinates of points are normalized to [-1, 1].

surf_stn.interpolate_disp(disp: Tensor, ras_coords: Tensor, affine_matrix: Tensor) → Tensor#

Interpolates the displacement field disp defined in voxel coordinate system at given points defined in RAS coordinate system.

Parameters:

  • disp – the given displacement field of shape 1 x 3 x H x W x D.

  • ras_coords – RAS coordinates of the given points of shape N x 3 at which new values are sampled.

  • affine_matrix – the affine matrix of shape 4 x 4 (read from NIfTI file).

Returns:

interpolated deformation field of shape N x 3

surf_stn.get_identity(image_shape: Size, device: str = 'cuda') → Tensor#

Returns the identity transformation of the given image_shape.

Parameters:

  • image_shape – the shape of the image tensor (e.g., H x W x D).

  • device – the device on which the tensor is allocated.

Returns:

the identity transformation of shape 1 x 3 x H x W x D.

surf_stn.ddf_to_disp(ddf: Tensor) → Tensor#

Converts dense displacement field (DDF) to displacement field (disp) by subtracting the identity transformation.

Parameters:

ddf – the dense displacement field of shape 1 x 3 x H x W x D.

Returns:

displacement field of shape 1 x 3 x H x W x D

surf_stn.surf_stn(ras_coords: Tensor, ddf: Tensor, affine_matrix: Tensor) → Tensor#

Given the dense displacement field ddf defined in voxel coordinate system, and the affine matrix affine_matrix that maps voxel to RAS coordinates, interpolates the displacement field at the voxel locations corresponding to each location in ras_coords.

Parameters:

  • ras_coords – RAS coordinates of the given points of shape N x 3.

  • ddf – the dense displacement field of shape 1 x 3 x H x W x D.

  • affine_matrix – the affine matrix of shape 4 x 4 (read from NIfTI file).

Returns:

deformed RAS coordinates of shape N x 3
